# Google Calendar node

Use the Google Calendar node to automate work in Google Calendar, and integrate Google Calendar with other applications. n8n has built-in support for a wide range of Google Calendar features, including adding, retrieving, deleting and updating calendar events.

On this page, you'll find a list of operations the Google Calendar node supports and links to more resources.

/// note | Credentials
Refer to [Google Calendar credentials](/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/index.md) for guidance on setting up authentication. 
///

--8<-- "_snippets/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/ai-tools.md"

## Operations

* **Calendar**
    * [**Availability**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlecalendar/calendar-operations.md#availability): If a time-slot is available in a calendar
* **Event**
    * [**Create**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlecalendar/event-operations.md#create): Add an event to calendar
    * [**Delete**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlecalendar/event-operations.md#delete): Delete an event
    * [**Get**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlecalendar/event-operations.md#get): Retrieve an event
    * [**Get Many**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlecalendar/event-operations.md#get-many): Retrieve all events from a calendar
    * [**Update**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlecalendar/event-operations.md#update): Update an event

## Templates and examples

<!-- see https://www.notion.so/n8n/Pull-in-templates-for-the-integrations-pages-37c716837b804d30a33b47475f6e3780 -->
[[ templatesWidget(page.title, 'google-calendar') ]]

## Related resources

n8n provides a trigger node for Google Calendar. You can find the trigger node docs [here](/integrations/builtin/trigger-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlecalendartrigger.md).

Refer to [Google Calendar's documentation](https://developers.google.com/calendar/api/v3/reference){:target=_blank .external-link} for more information about the service.

View [example workflows and related content](https://n8n.io/integrations/google-calendar/){:target=_blank .external-link} on n8n's website.

options.name: Availability
options.description: If a time-slot is available in a calendar

properties_schema.name: timeMin
properties_schema.description: Start of the interval, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

properties_schema.name: timeMax
properties_schema.description: End of the interval, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

options.name: outputFormat
Availability
options.description: Returns if there are any events in the given time or not

options.name: Booked Slots
options.description: Returns the booked slots

options.name: RAW
options.description: Returns the RAW data from the API
The format to return the data in

options.name: timezone
options.description: Time zone used in the response. By default n8n timezone is used.

options.name: Create
options.description: Add a event to calendar

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete an event

options.name: Get
options.description: Retrieve an event

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Retrieve many events from a calendar

options.name: Update
options.description: Update an event

properties_schema.name: start
properties_schema.description: Start time of the event, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

properties_schema.name: end
properties_schema.description: End time of the event, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

options.name: allday
options.description: Whether the event is all day or not

options.name: attendees
options.description: The attendees of the event. Multiple ones can be separated by comma.

options.name: color
options.description: The color of the event. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: conferenceDataUi

values.name: conferenceSolution
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

options.description: Creates a conference link (Hangouts, Meet etc) and attaches it to the event

options.name: guestsCanInviteOthers
options.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can invite others to the event

options.name: guestsCanModify
options.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can modify the event

options.name: guestsCanSeeOtherGuests
options.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are

options.name: id
options.description: Opaque identifier of the event

options.name: location
options.description: Geographic location of the event as free-form text

options.name: maxAttendees
options.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

options.name: rrule
options.description: Recurrence rule. When set, the parameters Repeat Frequency, Repeat How Many Times and Repeat Until are ignored.

options.name: sendUpdates
All
options.description: Notifications are sent to all guests

options.name: External Only
options.description: Notifications are sent to non-Google Calendar guests only

options.name: None
options.description: No notifications are sent. This value should only be used for migration use case.
Whether to send notifications about the creation of the new event

options.name: showMeAs
Available
options.description: The event does not block time on the calendar

options.name: Busy
options.description: The event does block time on the calendar
Whether the event blocks time on the calendar

options.name: summary
options.description: Title of the event

options.name: visibility
Confidential
options.description: The event is private. This value is provided for compatibility reasons.

options.name: Default
options.description: Uses the default visibility for events on the calendar

options.name: Private
options.description: The event is private and only event attendees may view event details

options.name: Public
options.description: The event is public and event details are visible to all readers of the calendar
Visibility of the event

properties_schema.description: If the event doesn't use the default reminders, this lists the reminders specific to the event

options.displayName: Return Next Instance of Recurring Event
options.name: returnNextInstance

properties_schema.name: returnAll
properties_schema.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties_schema.name: limit
properties_schema.description: Max number of results to return

properties_schema.name: timeMin
properties_schema.description: At least some part of the event must be after this time, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

properties_schema.name: timeMax
properties_schema.description: At least some part of the event must be before this time, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

options.name: timeMin
options.description: At least some part of the event must be after this time, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

options.name: timeMax
options.description: At least some part of the event must be before this time, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

options.name: singleEvents
options.description: Whether to expand recurring events into instances and only return single one-off events and instances of recurring events, but not the underlying recurring events themselves

options.name: fields
options.description: Specify fields to return, by default a predefined by Google set of commonly used fields would be returned. To return all fields, use '*', more info.

options.name: iCalUID
options.description: Specifies event ID in the iCalendar format to be included in the response

options.name: maxAttendees
options.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

options.name: orderBy
Start Time
options.description: Order by the start date/time (ascending). This is only available when querying single events (i.e. the parameter singleEvents is True).

options.name: Updated
options.description: Order by last modification time (ascending)
The order of the events returned in the result

options.name: query
options.description: Free text search terms to find events that match these terms in any field, except for extended properties

options.name: All Occurrences
options.description: Return all instances of recurring event for specified time range

options.name: First Occurrence
options.description: Return event with specified recurrence rule

options.name: Next Occurrence
options.description: Return next instance of recurring event

options.name: showDeleted
options.description: Whether to include deleted events (with status equals "cancelled") in the result

options.name: showHiddenInvitations
options.description: Whether to include hidden invitations in the result

options.name: timeZone
options.description: Time zone used in the response. The default is the time zone of the calendar.

options.name: updatedMin
options.description: Lower bound for an event's last modification time (as a RFC3339 timestamp) to filter by. When specified, entries deleted since this time will always be included regardless of showDeleted.

options.name: allday
options.description: Whether the event is all day or not
